glsa.title: Heimdal: Kerberos 4 buffer overflow in kadmin
glsa.synopsis: A possible buffer overflow in the Kerberos 4 component of Heimdal has been discovered.

background.p: Heimdal is a free implementation of Kerberos.

description.p: A buffer overflow was discovered in kadmind, a server for administrative access to the Kerberos database.

impact.p: By sending a specially formatted message to kadmind, a remote attacker may be able to crash kadmind causing a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the kadmind process.

workaround.p: For a temporary workaround, providing you do not require Kerberos 4 support, you may turn off Kerberos 4 kadmin by running kadmind with the --no-kerberos4 option.
